docs.title: Yo.
docs.text:
These routines are designed and constructed from studying and listening to people who are of high regard in this field, namely: Andrew Huberman, Andy Galpin, Rhonda Patrick, Jeremy Ethier, Jeff Nippard, and their likes. In most cases, if not always, I will cite their videos/papers/references in the routines I included on this page.

Please note that if there's ever a contradiction in the routines I listed here with what these people preach, then such a contradiction may be due to the following reasons:

Time constraints

I do not have the time to replicate everything that they suggested. In this case, I will modify it in such a way that does not introduce negative implications to the routine(s) as best as I can.

I do not know

There are more than thousands of these resources out there that I have yet to find out.

With that said, please contact me (email at the bottom of this page) if there is any mistake(s) for I want to be corrected.

email: fadlialim0029 at gmail dot com

docs.title: IN PROGRESS
docs.text:
Some reminders/warnings

  • Progression is important for muscle growth. If overtime the current setup is too easy (i.e: you can do up to 20 reps or it takes 20 reps to reach the until-failure bar), apply progressions (ex: add resistance bands for push-ups or put on a weighted backpack. For weights exercises, just increase the weights) 1

docs.title: Sets & Reps
docs.text: Type Sets Reps Dumbbell Bench Press 4 12 Narrow (diamond) Push-ups 3 until failure Hand Release Push-ups 3 until failure Push-ups Negatives 3 until failure One-sided Push-ups 3 until failure

docs.title: Kettle Bell Wrist Curl
docs.text:
Info

This exercise targets the wrist and forearms (fun fact: this is the wrist workout that most wrestlers do, including Spencer Lee!)

  1. Push-Ups: How To Use Them To Build Muscle ↩

docs.title: Chest
docs.text:
Some reminders/warnings

  • Progression is important for muscle growth. If overtime the current setup is too easy (i.e: you can do up to 20 reps or it takes 20 reps to reach the until-failure bar), apply progressions (ex: add resistance bands for push-ups or put on a weighted backpack. For weights exercises, just increase the weights) 4
  • Do not speed up your push-ups, slow down. If it's too easy, slow it down to 2 or 2.5 seconds per push up 1\(^,\) 2
  • When doing push-ups, do not shrug your elbow and do not flare your elbow 2

docs.title: Sets & Reps
docs.text: Type Sets Reps Dumbbell Bench Press 4 12 Narrow (diamond) Push-ups 3 until failure Hand Release Push-ups 3 until failure Push-ups Negatives 3 until failure One-sided Push-ups 3 until failure

docs.title: Dumbbell Bench Press
docs.text:
Info

Flat dumbbell bench press mostly targets the middle part of the chest. Use an incline dumbbell press (just a very slight incline, abt 15-30 degrees) variation to also target the upper part of the chest 10\(^,\) 11. To apply this incline variation if you don't have an inclineable bench, just put a plate under the bench. Similarly, use a decline dumbbell press (also a very slight decline, abt 15-30 degrees) variation to target the lower chest.

Warning

Before going into these push-ups routines, make sure to watch this video. It teaches you how to do push-up properly and you will thank your future self 9.

docs.title: Narrow (diamond) Push-ups
docs.text:
Info

This exercise targets the whole chest (and it aims to replace bench press) 5\(^,\) 6\(^,\) 7\(^,\) 8

docs.title: Decline Narrow (diamond) Push-ups
docs.text:
Info

This exercise gives more emphasis on the upper chest 8. Perform this variation in the same form as in Narrow (diamond) Push-ups above, but apply a declination (rest your feet on a bench/chair/couch).

docs.title: Incline Narrow (diamond) Push-ups
docs.text:
Info

This exercise gives more emphasis on the lower chest 8. Perform this variation in the same form as in Narrow (diamond) Push-ups above, but apply an inclination (rest your palms on a bench/chair/couch).

  1. Effect of Push-up Speed on Elbow Joint Loading, Paul Pei-Hsi Chou Et al. ↩

  2. The Perfect Push-Up To Build Muscle, Jeremy Ethier ↩↩

  3. Dr. Andy Galpin: How to Build Strength, Muscle Size & Endurance | Huberman Lab Podcast #65 ↩

  4. Push-Ups: How To Use Them To Build Muscle ↩

  5. Diamond Push-ups: Benefits, Muscles Used, and More, Debbie Luna, Danial Dominick ↩

  6. Contreras, Bret & Schoenfeld, Brad & Mike, Jonathan & Tiryaki-Sonmez, Raziye & Cronin, John & Vaino, Elsbeth. (2012). The Biomechanics of the Push-up. Strength and Conditioning Journal. 34. 41-46. 10.1519/SSC.0b013e31826d877b. ↩

  7. Kim YS, Kim DY, Ha MS. Effect of the push-up exercise at different palmar width on muscle activities. J Phys Ther Sci. 2016;28(2):446-449. doi:10.1589/jpts.28.446 ↩

  8. Grow Your Chest At Home: The BEST Home Chest Workout For Growth, Jeremy Ethier ↩↩↩

  9. How To Unlock Your Push Up Strength, Jeremy Ethier ↩

  10. How To Do Dumbbell Bench Press, Jeremy Ethier ↩

  11. Rodríguez-Ridao D, Antequera-Vique JA, Martín-Fuentes I, Muyor JM. Effect of Five Bench Inclinations on the Electromyographic Activity of the Pectoralis Major, Anterior Deltoid, and Triceps Brachii during the Bench Press Exercise. Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2020 Oct 8;17(19):7339. doi: 10.3390/ijerph17197339. PMID: 33049982; PMCID: PMC7579505. ↩
